raw_text:
Artists' secret postcards on sale
 
 Postcards by artists including Damien Hirst and Tracey Emin have sold just hours after the opening of the Royal Academy of Arts annual Secrets sale.
 
 The identity of the artist remains unknown until each work is bought and the signature is revealed on the back. "There are still some big names left, such as Mario Testino," said RCA spokeswoman Sue Bradburn. All postcards are priced at £35. The sale opened at 8am on Friday and will close at 6pm on Saturday. Ms Bradburn said there was a big queue at the start of the sale but it had now gone down.
 
 She said the people that had bought the famous name postcards had arrived early and had spent time studying each work. "They would have known what to look for." The exhibition has been open for viewing since 19 November. Film director Ken Loach, fashion designer Hussein Chalayan and former Blur guitarist Graham Coxon have all designed postcards for the sale. Some of the contributing artists are students or recent graduates of the Royal College of Art and other leading art colleges. Money raised from the sale will go towards the RCA's Fine Art Student Award Fund which supports students with grants and bursaries. The famous sale is now in its 11th year.
llama3.2:1b: Artists' secret postcards by Damien Hirst, Tracey Emin, Mario Testino, and others have sold for £35 each at the Royal Academy of Arts' annual Secrets sale after opening on Friday and closing on Saturday.

The identity of the artist is revealed when purchased. A big queue existed initially but decreased over time. Sales raise money for the RCA's Fine Art Student Award Fund.

Many attendees spent time studying works for their back signatures revealing identities until confirmed. Proceeds support student grants at RCA. The 11th year of this prestigious event marks its success as a fundraiser.

deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Alright, let me try to figure out how to approach this query. So, the user has provided a text about an art-themed postcard sale, including some key details like the artists involved, the price, when it's happening, who was there, and the funds raised. They want a summary that captures the main points without any extra info.

First, I need to understand what exactly is being asked. The user wants only the summary in plain text, no explanations or formatting. So my task is to condense the given paragraph into a concise version that includes all essential information.

I'll start by identifying the key elements from the original text: the artists, the price of postcards, when the sale opened and closed, who attended early, what Sue Bradburn said about big names, the funds raised, the viewing history, roles of specific directors and contributors, and the significance of the 11th year.

Next, I need to condense each of these points into one or two sentences. For example, instead of mentioning all the artists, just noting that some are students/graduates from RCOA or other institutions. Similarly, when talking about the queues at the start, mention that it's now gone but had a big crowd early on.

I should make sure to include Sue Bradburn's statement about big names and how visitors studied each work. Also, highlight the funds raised for the Student Award Fund and the 11th year significance.

Putting it all together, I need to ensure that everything is covered succinctly without any unnecessary details. It should flow well and retain the essence of the original text.
</think>

Artists' secret postcards on sale  
Postcards by artists including Damien Hirst and Tracey Emin have sold just hours after the Royal Academy of Arts annual Secrets Sale opened.  
All postcards are priced at £35, with tickets ranging from 8am Friday to 6pm Saturday.  
Sue Bradburn, RCA's spokeswoman, said "there are still some big names left, such as Mario Testino," and visitors would have studied each work to find the signature on the back.  
The exhibition has been open for viewing since November 19, with film director Ken Loach, fashion designer Hussein Chalayan, and former Blur guitarist Graham Coxon designing postcards for the sale.  
Some contributing artists are students or recent graduates of RCOA or other leading art colleges, raising funds for the Fine Art Student Award Fund.  
Known as "The Famous Sale," it is now its 11th year, showcasing works by prominent and rising artists.
tinyllama:1.1b: The Royal Academy of Arts has sold just a few hours after opening their Secret Sale, featuring postcards by artists including Damien Hirst and Tracey Emin. Identity remains unknown until each work is displayed on the back. Postcards are priced at £35, with only one artist left whose identity is still unknown. A big queue started to form at the beginning of the sale but has since gone down as viewers spent time studying each work. The exhibition was opened on 19 November and features contributions from students or recent graduates of some of the UK's leading art colleges, such as the Royal College of Art. The Secret Sale will be open for viewing until Saturday at 6 pm, with a portion of the proceeds going towards the RCAFine Art Student Award Fund.

The sale will begin at 8am on Friday and end at 6pm on Saturday, with a queue reportedly forming in the morning.
